text: A Call to Yahweh
Come, let us return to Yahweh;
because \add it is\add* he who has torn, and he will heal us;
he has struck us down and will bind us up.
He will revive us after two days;
on the third day he will raise us up,
that we may live in his presence.\f + \fr 6:2 \ft Or “before his face” \f*
Let us know, let us press on to know Yahweh;
his rising \add is\add* sure like \add the\add* dawn.
He will come like the showers to us,
like \add the\add* spring rain that waters \add the\add* earth.
What will I do with you, \add O\add* Ephraim?
What will I do with you, \add O\add* Judah?
Your love \add is\add* like a morning cloud,
like the dew that goes away early in the morning.
Therefore, I have hewn \add them\add* by \add the\add* prophets;
I have killed them by the words of my mouth,
and my judgment\f + \fr 6:5 \ft Hebrew “your judgments” \f* goes forth like the light.
Because I desire steadfast love and not sacrifice,
and knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.
But like Adam, they transgressed \add the\add* covenant;
there they dealt faithlessly with me.
Gilead \add is\add* a city of evil,
a cunning \add city\add* because of blood.\f + \fr 6:8 \ft The Hebrew is difficult; NRSV translates “tracked with blood” \f*
Like bandits lying in wait,
\add so is\add* a band of priests;
they murder \add on the\add* road to Shechem;
indeed, they commit a monstrous crime.
In the house of Israel I have seen something horrible;
Ephraim’s unfaithfulness \add is\add* there.
Israel is defiled.
Ephraim’s Guilt
